MESSAGE: *Flapjacks leads the group into the woods...*

>>> *A band of adventurers begins their journey in the Autumnal Forest, a place of vibrant colors and gentle breezes. As they walk along a winding path, the leaves crunch softly underfoot, and the scent of pine and earth fills the air.*
"A most impressive story, friend Axia.  Rocs are one of the more dangerous foes we may encounter on our journey."
"It was a beacon for certain." *Aillig adds.*
"Oh you were there as well?  Impressive."
*Sidling out of the bushes, the small goblin joins the group without a word, her floppy hat pulled down over her face*

"I was there too!" *Quinn pipes in.* "Biggest thing I've ever seen. Set the nest ablaze and everything." *Her ear turns to hear a bush rustling, and turns her head to see a smaller member join the group. She waves with a smile.*

*Having finally worked up enough favor to be given the wiggle room to leave alone, Mina is wandering excitedly about the wilderness. More room to stretch her legs and things to see. Maybe things to fight! Stumbling on other people through the underbrush she stops short, grinning wide.* 

‚ÄúOh! More folk out here. Looking for a brawl too?‚Äù
*Bounding down the trail comes a stout dwarf.*  "Hey there!  I heard a expedition was on it's way.  I could use a little action.  The name's Ra'vek."
*Saba shyly waved back, seeming reluctant to talk*
*Looking the group over, the goblin chooses the tallest and burliest member to walk behind in their shadow*
*This would likely be the 7ft tall Mina*

*Mina looks down behind her hearing a person and waves.* 

‚ÄúI‚Äôll make sure I don‚Äôt go taking too big a stride. You seem like good company.‚Äù
*Saba smiles up at Mina in response, showing far too many razor-sharp teeth for such a small mouth, but there is no malice in it, just poor dentistry*
*Aillig smiles at the gathering group, thinking the more hands the better after the aforementioned Roc encounter.*

*As they walk, Aillig begins drawing, letting instinct guide him in the creation of a new experimental sigil. As he seals the paper, he gets the sense that this one may help one to be more bold as they face a foe in combat.*

*Reaching under her hat, the goblin pulls an enormously plump grey rat out and holds him up toward Mina to show her, the rat yawning sleepily.*
‚ÄúPumpkin ratto.‚Äù

‚ÄúIs‚Ä¶is the rat named pumpkin or is it a pumpkin rat?‚Äù 

*She crouches to be more eye level with them both, her mass of pink curls still casting quite a shadow.*
*Looking around at the mist rising in the forest, Aillig pulls out a pair of old fashioned spectacles and slips them on after wiping condensation from the slightly iridescent lenses.*

*Saba thinks for a second, then answers*
‚ÄúRat is Pumpkin, Goblin is Saba‚Äù

> *The mist rolls in, and it comes with strange whispers and swirling patterns.  The mist swishes and twists, as if invisible shapes move within it.*
> 
> [In Sylvan]||"Pumpkin!  Pumpkin!  Pie?  Pumpkin pie?"||

*The shift to mist is concerning, but when the whispers start, Quinn's fur stands on end as she looks at the patterns, trying to discern what they mean but having no clues.* "Is anyone else seeing this?" *She asks, keeping a hand close to the dagger on her belt.*
*Saba squints and sniffs the air as the mist closes in*

‚ÄúWell, nice to meet you Pumpkin and Saba. People call me Mina.‚Äù 

*She offers a single finger headpat to the rat and then stands as her ears pick up her native tongue.*

‚ÄúHuh? Who‚Äôs playing tricks? Come on do better than that.‚Äù
*The rat accepts the pat and climbs onto Saba‚Äôs shoulder*

‚ÄúWant a leg up or you like your feet on the ground, mate?‚Äù 

*She asks Saba, getting an idea from the rat.*
((perception checks or you can roll nature to guess what it might be))
Mina'Khor Delhin makes a Perception check! 1d20 (17) + 4 = `21`
Quinn makes a Perception check! 1d20 (14) + 4 = `18`
Flapjacks-over-Eggs makes a Nature check! 1d20 (3) + 1 = `4`
*Seeing the fun Pumpkin and Saba are having Ra'vek turns his head to the side and speaks out apparently to nothing...*  "Hey Kly, you want to come out and last least say Hi?"

*.. and then, out of thin air a rat appears on Ra'vek's shoulder.  He gives a look at Ra'vek and everyone around... and appears to squint his eyes as if questioning if this was really neccessary.*
"Ah... there you go, Kly.  See, not too hard."

*Ra looks back to the group*  "Everyone, this is Klymok...  He'll be around from time to time."
Saba Ti makes a Nature check! 1d20 (14) + 12 = `26`

*Saba reaches up to Mina, never one to turn down a ride*
‚ÄúYes! Tall!‚Äù
*Pumpkin catches a whiff of Kly and squeaks a greeting to the other rat, his tail whisking back and forth*

*She bends and uses one hand to let her up onto her shoulder and sits her comfortably. The antler above her head like a natural handle.* 

‚ÄúAnd I ain‚Äôt even the tallest. Though, I can get a bit bigger. For a little.‚Äù

*Kly looks back and hisses.  He's apparently not very friendly.*

"Ok, Kly... that's enough.  Why don't you go take a look around that mist for us, eh?"

*And with that the rat pops back out of visibility.*
(Kly will turn invisible and change their shape into their natural form to fly up ahead.)

*Pumpkin‚Äôs ears flatten and he backs into Saba‚Äôs hood in alarm.
The goblin settles in like she‚Äôs always ridden Mina‚Äôs shoulder and exclaims about this new exciting vantage height, her Common a bit stilted and broken*
‚ÄúSo high! How more big?‚Äù

> *Quinn, Mina, and Ra'vek are able to identify four distinct shapes, one larger than the others.  They are roughly the size of cats or small dogs.  They flit about, just out of reach.*
> 
> *Saba has spent enough time in the NLP to hear stories of fey creatures in the forest that are more interested in pranks and tricks than violence.  Perhaps fairies, or pixies, maybe even a Pseudodragon or fairy dragon.*

*Saba watches the creatures without much concern, figuring them for illusions or fae. She leans to whisper to Mina*

‚Äú‚Ä¶Umph. If offer food, no eat. Music, no dance.‚Äù
"I have dried, salted cabbage chips, cabbage rolls, and a jar of pickled cabbage."
*Kly will fly up ahead and assess if there's any real concern here.*

‚ÄúFamily genes. I‚Äôll show you sometime.‚Äù 

*Walking ahead she pointedly ignores the fluttering fey. Trickery was a bother right now. As much as it was fun to partake in. Later maybe. For now, she mostly wanted a fight.*
*Saba nods, feeding Pumpkin a chunk of jerky. She also offers Mina a whole stick of homemade jerky as well, thinking she might get jealous*
"Thats a lot of cabbage...if we need any though, we will ask you, Flapjacks." *She watches and listens to the others, not having much to say but keeping pace.*
An unknown creature makes a Sleight Of Hand check! 1d20 (5) + 5 = `10`

> *An invisible set of teeth chomp down on the stick of jerky in Saba's hand, but they fail to rip it away.  With a frustrated squeak, a small dragon with butterfly wings appears, jaws still clamped on the jerky.*
*Saba makes a high pitched ‚ÄòEee‚Äô noise and lets the meat go*

*Seeing the little dragon after the food, Aillig pulls out a crossbow bolt. Concentrating on it, he imagines the technomagical process that would be needed to alter the bolt‚Äôs odor. Rearing back he throws the bolt as far into the woods as he can, the bolt leaving a faint odor of the most luscious roast in its wake*

*Mina frowns and flicks a hand out quickly, the jerky offered her halfway in her mouth. Snatching it back she sticks her tongue out at the tiny thing as she hands the food back.*

*Sylvan* ||Bad dragon! Go pick on something your size. This one is close but still bigger than you. Go bother bugs||

*Pointing in the direction he threw the bolt, Aillig adds*

*Sylvan* ||There is a yummy roast over there, can‚Äôt you smell how good it will be?||

(Kly will have approached the shapes ahead, flying 20ft above)

*Ra‚Äôvek takes a moment to close his eyes and look through Kly‚Äôs eyes instead.*

(What does he see?  Is he able to distinguish the larger shape from the smaller ones?  Does he see anything of value on/near them?)

> *The larger shape has just appeared near Saba and Mina.  The smaller ones are still invisible and flitting around.  There is nothing visible on them, valuable or otherwise.  The large one doesn't seem to have anything.*
> 
> *When Mina hands the food back, the dragon yips happily and starts doing flips in the air.  The small ones pop into view as well.  Then the delicious smelling bolt flies into the forest.  The three smaller dragons dart off after it, while the larger one alights upon a tree branch to munch happily.*
*Flapjacks withdraws his hand from his snack bag.*  "I suppose they don't prefer cabbage chips."

*Recovering from her fright, Saba watches the little ones swoop in. She rummages in her sleeves and pulls out another jerky stick, seeming to have an endless supply hidden in her pockets*

‚ÄúCan share‚Ä¶little flutterby hungry?‚Äù
*‚Ä¶but she is too late, they zip away after the crossbow bolt. Saba crunches on one end herself instead*

*Kly snaps back out of his Kly vision satisfied that there‚Äôs no real threat (or opportunity).  He then catches an odor on his nose‚Ä¶* 

‚ÄúHey, anyone smell roasted turkey?! ü¶É‚Äù

‚ÄúAh don‚Äôt pay it no mind. Tricky bastards, not terrible most the time. Still, give em an inch and you give em a mile.‚Äù 

*She chomps down on the jerky some.* 

‚ÄúSo, should we move on?‚Äù
‚ÄúAye, still a long trail ahead, best to move along‚Äù
"Agreed. We don't need to wait around long enough for all our packs to be stolen too." *Quinn holds tighter to the straps of her own.*
*Still chewing, Saba doesn‚Äôt say anything at all, but points forward with her free hand*
"Ah... let's head on out.  Cheeky bastards might not be content with just jerkey for long"  *And Ra starts walksing*
*Flapjacks leads on deeper into the woods.*
> *Flapjacks leads the group through a disguised crack in the rock.  They descend a muddy slope and find themselves in a jungle.*

> *Full of lush plants and towering trunks, the sweltering jungle is covered by a dense layer of naturally-knit branches that blot out the sky. Bubbling out of vents in the ground, geothermal energy is expelled and trapped within a natural greenhouse. From above, icy water drips down through the branches and works with luminescent crystals to nourish an overgrown rainforest floor. The air is abound with not only the sound of dripping, but also the calls and songs of exotic wildlife---of which soar through the crowded airspace and scamper over thorny foliage and glowing fungi.*

((From the channel description))
"Be cautious.  I have experienced strange things among these trees."
*Klymok will be back in his invisible form flying around as he so does.*
*Having traded treats and been given sweets, Pumpkin bounces along on the ground*
"At least we don't have  to worry about the cold" *States Aillig, grateful to be warm again*

*Mina follows along behind Pumpkin, still holding Saba if she wanted to be held. Otherwise she's following the goblin too. She hums softly as she walks, glaive over her shoulder, seeming to be rather well and fully good to go after their rest.*
> *Softly, from the distance, the party hears a cry "Help me!  Help me!"*
*Saba would have woken refreshed and ready to shuffle along beside Mina*

*Quinn follows along with the group, keeping pace with Aillig. His comment makes her nod.* "No kidding." *After a short while though, her ears flick forward, and she pauses to hear better.* "Someone's calling for help!" *She picks up the pace, following the direction of the call.*

*Saba sniffs the air suspiciously, remembering a similar scenario that ended in tragedy*
‚ÄúWait! May be hag‚Ä¶‚Äù
Saba Ti makes a Perception check! 1d20 (7) + 0 = `7`
"Indeed. Sometimes the cabbage turns out to be lettuce."
*Raising an eyebrow at Saba‚Äôs mention of hags, Aillig cups his ear trying the hear better*
*Saba casts mage armor in herself in anticipation of a bad time*
Aillig MacCaird makes a Perception check! 1d20 (6) + 3 = `9`
*Saba frantically calls Pumpkin back to her, pulling out her staff*
*Ra‚Äôvek also feels much better after their rest is cautious about jumping into another quarrel.*.
[Goblin] ||‚ÄùBeloved rat child, come here! I know the nice man gave you sweets but there may be hags afoot!‚Äù||
Mina'Khor Delhin makes a Perception check! 1d20 (10) + 4 = `14`
*Mina tunes in to everyone else's paying attention and decides she probably should too.*
Quinn makes a Perception check! 1d20 (19) + 4 = `23`
*The rat reluctantly gallops back to Saba from dogging Ra‚Äôvek‚Äôs feet, hopeful for more sweets*
*Beginning to worry from her team's suspicions, Quinn keeps a careful ear out for what was ahead, keeping light on her feet in case she needs to attack quickly.*

> *As Quinn gets closer, she sees a small glowing light, flitting through the trees.  Mina sees a second light race by, seemingly following the first.*
> 
> *"Help me!  Help me"*
> 
> *Quinn can pinpoint the voice as coming from the lead light.  Perhaps it is fleeing from the other?*
*Ra‚Äôvek slips into the shadows to take a closer look.*

*Quinn's stomach leaps into her throat at the sight of two lights, fleeing quickly from somewhere. She preps a dagger in hand.* "Follow those lights!" *She shouts back, chasing after the lead light through the trees.* "Hey, hold up! We are here to help!" *She calls.*
Ra makes a Stealth check! 1d20 (12) + 7 = `19`
*Mina isn't quite so inclined to follow swiftly. This smelled of pranks and pixies. Still, she sighs and grasps her weapon as she goes to follow the others. Trying to remain on the alert.*
*Before approaching closer, Ra takes a moment to peer through his friend‚Äôs eyes*

An Imp makes a Perception check! 2d20kh1 (6, ~~4~~) + 1 = `7`
>>> *Klymok*
*Kly is off to the side not paying any attention to these lights or calls for help.  Ra‚Äôvek decides to listen in instead with his keen sense of hearing.*
Ra makes a Perception check! 1d20 (15) + 7 = `22`

> *The (fleeing?) light responds to Quinn's cries, and begins to circle around towards the party.  It continues shouting. "Please somebody help me!  Isn't anyone there?!  Ahh!"  Soon it will run (hover) into Quinn.*
> 
> *From his position, Ra'vek can hear a faint sound coming from the (chasing?) light. A whispering, low and rough.  "Come to me... me..."*
*Telepathically Ra‚Äôvek commands Kly to stop chasing damn rabbits and get over here- we‚Äôve got trouble brewing!*

*Quinn follows the light, trying to find a way to stop it or even prevent it from being caught. She is unsuccessful until eventually the light comes right to her, and she cups her hands around the light, hoping to protect it.* "It's okay! I'll keep you safe, what's happening?" *She asks quietly, keeping her ears turning.*
*Following the group, as soon as she knows these are flying creatures the goblin readies something energy-based in her hands, a faint glow emanating*

*Looking around confused, Aillig simply shakes his head and states* ‚ÄúWell, that was‚Ä¶ something‚Ä¶‚Äù

*Quinn is relieved when the chasing wisp is defeated, no longer threatening the one in her hand. She gazes down at it, about to ask if it was alright, when it stops shaking and thanks her. A strange, soft magic comes over Quinn, and she recognizes it as a blessing before the wisp flies away into the forest. The cat is stunned speechless for a few before letting out a short, breathy laugh.* "Hah...not how I expected that going. But at least we protected it. Wonder what caused that whole situation in the first place though..." *She puts her dagger back onto her belt.*
"I must be more cautious in the future and not just destroy any wisps I come across ..."
"Well, that one obviously wasn't a good one." *Quinn shrugs.* "If something needs help, it'd be unfortunate to just...walk away."

‚ÄúStrange‚Ä¶‚Äù
*She eyes the trees around them*
‚ÄúNo creature act right here.‚Äù
*Ra‚Äôvek slashes lazily at some ferns and talks to his shadow blade* ‚ÄúPatience my old friend‚Äù *‚Ä¶and the blade is dispelled*

*Looking to the rest of them*

"I was previously owned by a much crueler master than my current patron.  Due to some sleight, he saw fit to erase my memories, give me a new name, curse my speech so that I could only talk about cabbage, and require that I work at a tavern. "I came to the island because he sold my contract to a genie of the volcano here.  My current master asks very little of me, and so I am now free to name myself whatever I wish, and my speech is not cursed.

*Ra‚Äôvek listens with interest.* ‚ÄúAye, difficult indeed. I‚Äôm sorry to hear hear you were cursed.  That must have been a trying time. You must be enjoying the freedom this‚Ä¶ genie has offered you.‚Äù

Note:Whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce an _experimental elixir_ in an empty flask you touch. As an action, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to an incapacitated creature.

You can create additional _experimental elixirs_ by expending a spell slot of 1st level or higher for each one. When you do so, you use your action to create the elixir in an empty flask you touch, and you choose the elixir's effect from the Experimental Elixir table.

Creating an _experimental elixir_ requires you to have alchemist's supplies on your person, and any elixir you create with this feature lasts until it is drunk or until the end of your next long rest.

*Well, there was only one left to stand in her way. Mina slashes twice, mostly just to ensure the job was finished.*

"Gross. Even more than the spiders." 

*Her nose wrinkles.*
End Init
"Indeed, most unpleasant."
‚ÄúHow creatures come back ? Resurrect not work right?‚Äù
*She shuffles over to inspect the nearest corpse, holding her rib over her mouth and nose to block the smell again*
"There are stories of people who got lost in the swamps and resorted to cannibalism, who continued even after death.  Another good reason to pack these..."  *He holds up some cabbage rolls.*

*Saba comes over to Flapjack and reaches up for one of the cabbage rolls, out of goblin range*
‚ÄúIs food?‚Äù
"Yes, this one is venison, I believe."  *Flapjacks offers it with a bow, both hands flat upward.*

*Ra‚Äôvek walks over to Aillig* ‚ÄúNice work with all of that acid.  Hopefully it helps dissolve some of the stench as well‚Äù

*He grabs his canteen and takes a swig of water* ‚ÄúSo ‚Ä¶ you mentioned Sigil a bit ago.  That‚Äôs actually where I came from recently too.  Are you originally from there?‚Äù
*Saba takes the roll reverently and sniffs it, then eats it messily* "Mmph...thank you!"
*Pumpkin pops out to snag a bite as the goblin effectively smears herself in cabbage roll goodness*
*While licking her fingers, she asks Flapjack* "Swamp have undead stinkers always?"
"Yes, though this part is not quite as infested as the area called The Cursed Bog.  It is an accurate name.  Though I did find an interesting variety of skunk cabbage there..."

*Saba seems to gloss over there being a worse swamp and mentally pictures this skunk cabbage. She raises a brow, looking disconcerted*
‚ÄúSkunk big stinker, cabbage smell like animal or look like? Eat? Or throw?‚Äù
"It smells of the animal.  It is not truly a cabbage at all, though it is marginally edible if one is desperate."

*The goblin makes a yech face*
‚ÄúHope not ever that hungry.‚Äù
"Indeed, friend Saba."

*The goblin looks surprised and tickled pink to be called friend.*
‚ÄúMirewatch still far, Friend Flapjack?‚Äù
"No, we are quite close, in fact.  Perhaps another ten minutes, at most."

*As the party prepares to head back out, you see Ra‚Äôvek kicking mud off his boots.* ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know about you guys, but I‚Äôm ready to dry out.  Maybe after a night of good rest we could go find some drier regions to explore.  There‚Äôs a desert out here somewhere, right?‚Äù
"Ah yes.  When last there I was almost devoured by gigantic sand worms."
‚ÄúWow- how did you escape?  I‚Äôve heard those can be extremely deadly.‚Äù

*Shaking himself out of a daydream Aillig replies to Ra‚Äôvek‚Äôs question.* ‚ÄúYes, I was based out of Sigil. I actually had just entered a portal destined to a place not unlike this swamp when I was‚Ä¶ rerouted somehow. I‚Äôve spent most of my life working as a sigil agent based there‚Äù
"Amazing that you both came here from the same city."

*Ra‚Äôvek was grabbing a quick jerky snack out of his backpack while juggling two conversations.  Hearing Aillig reply, he snaps back his attention towards him.* ‚ÄúInteresting‚Ä¶ I thought those portals were reliable.‚Äù

*He pauses‚Ä¶* ‚ÄúDo you know of a portal back from here?‚Äú

*Ra‚Äôvek then looks back to FJ* ‚ÄúWell, my route wasn‚Äôt quite as direct‚Ä¶ but perhaps that can be solved‚Ä¶‚Äù

*And he looks back to Aillig for a reply.*

‚ÄúI hope I run into you folk more. This was‚Ä¶well the best time I had in a while. Getting to explore finally is doing me wonders.‚Äù 

*Mina grins widely at the party, shoving as many of her curls out her face as she can in their current rather fuzzy state.*
"This was quite an adventure, but hey, we all made it out mostly unscathed! Could have been way worse." *Quinn chuckles.*
‚ÄúRa‚Äôvek continues to chat with his new friends as they happily walk away from the swamp and towards the outpost.*

*The goblin smiles and bows to everyone*
‚ÄúAlways welcome at Mammoth Hut, happy to travels with fine adventurers like you.‚Äù
*Mina arrives with the others. Far less tired than the last time she had ended up at an outpost. Happy to get more time out and about.*
*Arriving amongst his companions, Aillig is grateful that this was a shorter, if somewhat smellier, trip through the wilderness.*
*Following her companions, she smiles and looks around at this new place*
*Quinn takes in the sight, thankful to have arrived safely. She could have done with all the foes along the way, but they made it there alive, and that's what mattered.*

*Ra‚Äôvek strides into the outpost with a wide smile and laugh as he and his companions arrive.*. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a great ‚Ä¶‚Äù

*He pauses mid-sentence as a beat-up, clearly drunk Lizardfolk stumbles too closely towards him.  With an agile side-step he clears the path for the Lizardfolk to shuffle by; all the while keeping a close eye on him and the surroundings.* ‚ÄúBest we keep our eyes and ears open while here.  We‚Äôre not in the City of Lights anymore.‚Äù
"Ah, on that point, we should find the crystal linking this place to the City. It will be good to nae have teh crawl through that swamp again if needing to visit here."
*Chirping happily, Saba runs off to get into a bit of trouble in this rough and tumble place*

"I think I see that aetheryte over there." *gestures Ra'vek*
"And somewhere around here is a two story building with food and drink."
"Could do with a good meal and a drink or so." *Aillig replies*

*After waving farewell to Saba and Flapjacks, Ra'vek and his remaining companions (Allig, Quinn, and Mina ) head across the output in search of a place to sit down.  It doesn't take long before they see an old, 2 story, storehouse converted to a bar.*  "Let's go!"

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Ra'vek peaks into the ramshackle lower room*  "Ah, perhaps it's nicer upstairs.  After that swamp, I could use some comfort."  
*He points to the stairs and heads up*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Mina keeps outside when they arrive. She sits wherever she finds for a decent seat and tries desperately to get her curls to tame themselves from the humidity of the swamps. It‚Äôs a process. Lots of sylvan cursing under her breath as her fingers weave and tangle in the pink mass that over time becomes a bit more manageable. Bit by bit.*

*Sliding over to the table with a grin.* 

‚ÄúCan I join you?‚Äù

MESSAGE: *Aillig smiles broadly.* "I havenae idea, but for some reason this hand has me feeling somehow more powerful. I'm fer thinking I may come to like this game."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
"Ah, yes.... the game is called Hold'em.  Origins are not for certain, but rumors claim it comes from some mystical land called "Tehas".  *Ra'vek then proceeds to explain the game.*

"And so, as you can see the winner is usually whoever has the best cards, or is really good at reading the table to see who's lying during betting, or is really good at bluffing and lying themselves during betting."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *At this point the Hag MUST have come in... and Ra'vek is enjoying an ale and has, indeed, ordered rabbit stew*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
‚ÄúHow do you know if you have the best cards?‚Äù 

*Mina asks, looking at her own hand before looking back up at him.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
"Ah.. as I was explaining earlier... this is a variant of a game called poker.  You'll want to combine your two hole cards with the others to make the best poker hand."  *Ra'vek then proceeds to lay out all the various types of hands*

"And this.... this is the Royal Flush.  It's *very* rare."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *As the card game comes to a close, food starts coming out* ‚Äú excellent! I‚Äôm starving‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Quinn laughs as she finds she wins the second round, leaning back in her chair.* "You could call *me* royal after those two easy victories."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Mina has no idea what‚Äôs just happened but she knows lying was involved.* 

‚ÄúCards seem fun but also complicated‚Ä¶I feel like I need whole lessons on this.‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: ‚ÄúIt is an interesting game. But these cards are fascinating.‚Äù*Says Aillig, examining several closely.*‚ÄùI wonder if I may be able to adapt the card idea in some way‚Ä¶‚Äù *He drifts off, staring into space*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *As Ra'vek enjoys his stew he ponders..* "I wonder what lies beyond this outpost?  Has anyone been beyond this point?  I hear there's a lake out yonder somewhere."  *And he waggles his fork towards the window before sloshing down another slip of his pint.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
‚ÄúThis is the furthest I ever been outside the arena. Finally did enough good in someone‚Äôs eye to get permission. And I‚Äôm milking every second of it cause the moment I‚Äôm back I dunno when it will happen again.‚Äù 

*Mina confesses, dropping her chin atop her arms settled atop the back of the chair.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Saba shuffles in, looking around the establishment curiously*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *She pales to see a hag as the proprietor, but senses no malice coming from them. The goblin looks for familiar faces hopefully*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Not finding anyone she recognizes in this upper area, she hesitantly heads down the stairs to the louder area, cringing back against the wall as a few denizens quickly clomp past her, stepping on her robe in the process*
"..eyyy..."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Mina is rather immediately visible as a pink topped tower at the table.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Saba quickly sidesteps the strangers and heads for the visible pink tower that is Mina, and grins to find Ra‚Äôvek, Aillig and Quinn there as well*
‚ÄúStill here? Lively outpost‚Ä¶‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: "Indeed" *Replies Aillig, scooting over to make room* "we decided on taking a bit of a rest before pushing onward. And Ra has been teaching us a new game."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: ‚ÄúHey Saba.  Welcome back!  I was just asking if anyone has been out beyond the outpost here.  You‚Äôre the most experienced here in these lands.  Got any stories on what‚Äôs beyond that swamp?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
‚ÄúWelcome my shoulder companion! I think you‚Äôre a good luck charm, you know that?‚Äù 

*Mina says with a wide grin as she sees Saba approach.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Quinn waves to Saba with a smile, letting the others make their greetings.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Sitting down beside Aillig, Saba dangles her feet and swings them a bit as she greets Quinn, Ra and Mina with a smile*
‚ÄúI have never been this far before. Saba is‚Ä¶homebody. But trying‚Ä¶.new things for new me.‚Äù

*Emphasis put on the word ‚Äònew‚Äô. She looks at the cards on the table.*
‚ÄúHow play?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: Ra makes a Perception check! 1d20 (10) + 7 = `17`

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: (Does Ra'vek notice anything particularly *new* about Saba?)

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: (New jewelry, no rat in sight)

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Ra'vek will pull the cards back out and happily explain the game to Saba.   He also notices something new...* "Saba, what is this unique jewelry you've picked up?  It looks very nice."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*She pulls off two rings, offering them for inspection*
‚ÄúRing of Warmth and Spell storing. Useful for travels.‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Mina gives them a curious look as well.* 

‚ÄúLovely stuff. Did notice more people out here had more magic stuff than I knew before. Is it common to do that?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*The goblin nods enthusiastically*
‚ÄúNorthern Lights have strong magical field‚Ä¶ makes easy to craft items. Sometimes fight more easy with magic item.‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*The goblin reaches under her hat automatically and finds no rat per usual*
‚ÄúOh‚Ä¶Pumpkin on vacation. But rat wear magic rock give him fire burps sometimes‚Ä¶‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Ra‚Äôvek gives Saba an inquisitive look when she says ‚Äòfire burps‚Äô but doesn‚Äôt probe further. Instead he‚Äôs curious about her prior statement.* 
‚ÄúYesss‚Ä¶. I‚Äôve heard about all the crafting on this island. I haven‚Äôt seen it yet tho.  Do you know where I could find someone with such knowledge?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Mina tries very hard and fails to hold back a yawn. Hardly one of boredom, but that day had been the most exciting she‚Äôd had in some time. But she is hardly willing for it to be over yet.*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Saba doesn‚Äôt quite understand, and she shows the rings again*
‚ÄúSaba make rings, put little fire this one and big boom this one. You need thing made?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: ‚ÄúHmmm, imbuing rings with power, ah can see how that would be useful. And it reminds me of a trick that my mentor could do to store some power in a ring that he could call upon later to infuse an extra sigil. I should pick up a simple ring and see if I can replicate that.‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Ra‚Äôvek‚Äôs eyebrows raise* ‚ÄúOh, nice Saba.  So **you** made the rings.  You‚Äôll have to show me how you did that whenever we make it back to the city,‚Äù

*He then looks to Aillig* ‚ÄúMaybe you‚Äôd be interested in a lesson too, eh?‚Äù

*It‚Äôs at this time Ra‚Äôvek also notices Mina and Quinn getting a bit quiet‚Ä¶ and yawning* ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a long day‚Ä¶ perhaps we should wrap this day up though, eh?‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
"I hate cutting a good conversation short...but I am starting to feel it." 

*Mine rubs at her face a bit, suppressing another yawn.*

"As much as I may know my way around a fight, this is the most actual fighting i've had a chance to do in...ever. Practice can only compare so much."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Saba nods and returns her rings to her fingers*
‚ÄúAillig yes, extra spell hide inside one ring. Take time, but useful. Maybe ask rat next time you see if will sell his bloodstone spell keeper.‚Äù

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE:
*Ra‚Äôvek slowly stands up* ‚ÄúI‚Äôm off to get some shut eye.  It‚Äôs been a long day.  See ya‚Äôll in the mornin‚Äù

*And he walks out*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: "Indeed. We should get some sleep before moving on. I'll be seein' you all in the morning."

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *The goblin looks around and decides to sleep under the table they were all sitting at*

LOCATION_NAME: South Island: Mirewatch Outpost - The Muddy Pitch
MESSAGE: *Mina has no idea how to go about getting a room. So she just dips her head onto the table and starts to snore within minutes.*
> *The group slowly gathers and leaves the temporary comforts of the outpost as they journey back into the stench of the swamp*
(What are you doing as you arrive in the swamp?)

*Once again walking through the muck, the mud threatening to take a boot at every step, Aillig sighs audibly.* ‚ÄúI was forgettin‚Äô we‚Äôd have to slog through this stuff again to get back out of Mirewatch‚Äù
*Quinn is none too pleased to have to wade through the swamp again, wincing at every slosh and suck of the mud. But she trudges forward, following along with the group.*

*Saba takes one look at the swamp and heaves a sigh*
‚ÄúWhy always wet.‚Äù
*She starts tucking her patchwork robes into themselves to keep the hems out of the muck*

*Mina for once has put her hair back. It doesn't do terribly too much other than keep the immediate frizzing directly out of her eyes and going down her back instead.*

"I wonder that myself, friend."

*The goblin looks distracted by wading through mud, but approaches Aillig. She seems a little more filled with magical energy than the last trip out.*

 ‚ÄúAillig‚Ä¶.I go on trip, deal gorgon...learn unkind spell type. Deal dead, learn worse spell type‚Ä¶Saba have concern about magic types. Which best?‚Äù
*She describes a spell that turns flesh to stone, a spell that animates corpses, and a spell that captures lightning and puts it to work to Aillig to illustrate her point*

‚ÄúHmm,‚Äù *Aillig looks thoughtful for a moment.* ‚ÄúAn old mentor always told me that the best magic is the one that you actually use. At its basic, it means the one that seems the most useful more of the time, but at its true root it means that which feels the most right to you.‚Äù
*He smiles* ‚ÄúSo, what calls to you? Turning things to stone, raising the unliving to do your bidding or calling lighting to cater to your whims?‚Äù

> *As you take your first few minutes into the swamp forest you feel the temperature drop as the sun hides behind the canopy above.  The air feels thick‚Ä¶ damp with earth and decaying leaves.  You see moss hanging in long, ghostly tendrils from the gnarled branches overhead. The ground beneath your feet grows softer and more treacherous; the once firm earth giving way to patches of muck and stagnant pools of water. Vines twist and coil around the trunks of ancient trees, their leaves a vibrant green that contrasts sharply with the dark undergrowth. The swamp seems to pulse with an almost sentient awareness of your presence and closes in around you. The hair on your neck instinctually rises.*
(What would you like to do?)
*Looking around, Aillig tries to think back to what he was taught of the natural world, trying to determine what is going on*
(roll a Nature Check)
*Mina just tries to stay sharp. She's not used to this kind of place, and she doesn't want to be caught lacking.*
Aillig MacCaird makes a Nature check! 1d20 (10) + 4 = `14`
(roll Perception)
Aillig's experience in nature tells them that the flora here has been affected by something unnatural; something has changed the plant-life all around.
"Something unnatural has affected the plant life here. We should be on guard." *Aillig states, turning to Mina he asks,* "See anything I missed?"
Mina'Khor Delhin makes a Perception check! 1d20 (**1**) + 4 = `5`

*Quinn's fur stands up across her body, ears twisting this way and that, trying to get a sense of her surroundings.* "What do you mean by unnatural?" *She asks warily, avoiding touching the trees as much as she can.*
"I'm not exactly certain..." *Aillig trails off as he looks at the trees more intently, trying to assess the source of the wrongness.*

‚ÄúNot a thing! But uh, that might also just be a me problem.‚Äù 

*She replies as she tries to brush stray frizz out of her eyes.*

> *You first notice that your visibility is heavily obscured in this forested marshland; the light filtering through the canopy becomes dimmer, casting everything in a perpetual twilight. You can rarely see beyond 30 ft.  The chirping of birds and rustling of small animals has become more sporadic and subdued. Instead, the croaking of frogs, the buzzing of insects, and the occasional splash of unseen creatures breaking a water's surface has become the backdrop.*
> *Indeed. Mina is not really familiar with this environment and just finds the whole place pretty disgusting.*
Aillig MacCaird makes an Arcana check! 1d20 (13) + 7 = `20`

> *Aillig has seen something like this before.  There‚Äôs a clear transmutation magic here within the swamp‚Äôs forest. It‚Äôs likely causing the extra thick vegetation and perhaps responsible for the especially warped and twisted trees.*
*Saba perks up and gives a big sniff after silently spacing out to consider Aillig‚Äôs wise words*
‚ÄúThis is magic. Transmutation. It must be. The only questions are, who or what did this, and where are they?‚Äù
"That is...more than one question."

*You see Ra‚Äôvek snap out of a daze - the same one when he‚Äôs peering through Kly‚Äôs eyes*  ‚ÄúFrom what I tell with Kly, this must be the Snakewood I was hearing about back at the outpost. It should lead to the floodplains, but it‚Äôs not looking any better ahead.‚Äú

*He turns to Saba‚Ä¶* ‚ÄúDid you smell something? It‚Äôs all rot and decay to me‚Äù
Saba Ti makes a Perception check! 1d20 (5) + 0 = `5`
‚ÄúYes, rot. Muck. Not much else‚Äù

*Quinn listens to everyone's input, worried about venturing further into the land, but knowing there was something better on the other side, kept going forth.* "Can we do anything about this? Or just suffer through it to the other side?"
> *Indeed. Saba has a hard time noticing much of anything given all the bugs flying around her.*

> *The party gathers and starts trudging down the loosely formed path in the swampland.  You continue to notice that some of the trees in this forest are twisted and malformed. You can‚Äôt help but think they resemble tortured creatures who are extending their clawlike branches toward you in desperation‚Ä¶ or terrible malice.*

> *You sense the trail is slowly starting to descend into a lower portion of the swamp here.  A dense fog blankets the marsh, reducing visibility to mere feet and casting everything in a ghostly pallor. The ground is treacherously uneven, with hidden pools of water and patches of sinking mud. The silence is occasionally broken by the distant call of a lone bird or the splash of an unseen creature.*
Aillig MacCaird makes a Survival check! 1d20 (15) + 0 = `15`
*Saba keeps close to Mina*
> *Despite the nearly invisible path that winds through the marsh you are able to navigate successfully through the foggy mire.*
> *Eventually the trail opens to a small clearing.  Sunlight once again finds its way through the canopy and the fog clears.  Ahead you see a large thicket of thorns covered in dark red berries.*
*Aillig looks at the thicket, trying to identify the plants that make it up*
(Nature check for anyone interested in identifying them)
Mina'Khor Delhin makes a Nature check! 1d20 (18) + 2 = `20`

> *As Aillig moves in to inspect the thicket, Mina rushes forward.  She‚Äôs very familiar with these, although she‚Äôs only seen a few in her life. They are Vermillion Bloomberries.  They are very rare, and well sought after for their health benefits.*

*Mina gets really close to a bunch of the berries and squints. Then sniffs. Then pokes.* 

‚ÄúOh these would do anyone good. You don‚Äôt see these just anywhere. Might make a good thing to bring with us! Eating em isn‚Äôt a bad idea either.‚Äù

*She promptly sets the example by taking some carefully off the bush and shoving it in her mouth.*
*Quinn is excited about the prospect of food, and quickly takes a handful from the bush, eating alongside Mina.*

*Aillig follows them forward and after popping a few of the berries in his mouth begins to examine one more closely.* "I wonder if these would make a good ink?" *He asks no one in particular and proceeds to pull out his kit to begin experimenting with the vibrant berries. After a short while he holds up a vial full of a dark red liquid.* "Well, only one thing to do, and thats to see what it can make."
*He sketches out two new sigils and seals them into cases, stating* "We'll see how effective these are later"

*Seeing everyone enjoy the berries, Ra‚Äôvek starts harvesting a handful and pops them in his mouth.* ‚ÄúWow- quite tasty.‚Äù

*For just a moment he‚Äôs relaxed and enjoying the bit of sunshine here*

*The goblin sidles up to the berries and eyes them, plucking one to trace its stem hole against a sleeve, leaving a smear. She views the color and makes a note to check in on the chemical decomposition of the berry's color process over time. Then she stuffs a few into her mouth, chewing as she speaks*
"We see how color fare raw. If stable, then can distill and set for cloth."
*The goblin pokes through the plant a bit, sniffing the foliage, babbling about dye processes* "Some dye do well mix ash. Some soak in with nightwater. Some want hot sun."
> *With everyone satisfied on berries you continue down the path.  The sun is high overhead as morning has passed.*

> *The swamp stretches out in eerie stillness beneath a pale blue sky, its usual gloom softened by the midday light. Here, the trails converge into a tangled intersection, each path a thin strip of mud and decaying leaves, barely raised above the stagnant pools of water that surround them.*

It appears to be digging in the dirt looking for something.  There‚Äôs definitely something strange about how it‚Äôs moving.  It hasn‚Äôt noticed you yet.*

> 
> *By mid-afternoon, the wind picks up and sweeps through the trees, rustling leaves and stirring the air.  It begins to get colder and darker in this already dim light forest.  You instinctually pull your traveling cloaks around you closer.*

New Scene

> *Having rested the party continues deeper into the swamp.  It's closer to late afternoon at this point.*
> 
> *Towering cypress trees rise from the dark, murky water, their knotted roots forming natural bridges and small islands. Spanish moss drapes from the branches, creating an eerie, almost surreal curtain that sways gently in the breeze. The air is thick with humidity and the sound of frogs and cicadas fills the silence.*
> 
> *After a couple of hours of travel Quinn and Ra'vek notice something ahead.  There, nestled within the dense, murky heart of the swamp lies an old, abandoned caravan tilted awkwardly on a broken wheel. Vines creep up its faded wooden sides, and faint carvings of whimsical animals and swirling patterns are barely visible beneath layers of grime. The caravan‚Äôs once-bright paint has peeled away, leaving only faint hints of gold and emerald green.   Scattered outside are small, peculiar trinkets‚Äîa tiny wind chime made of bones and shells, a crude wooden stool, and a basket of dried herbs and flowers tied with a bright red ribbon.*

(What do you do?)
*Ra'vek will point out the caravan to the others.*
*Aillig pauses the consider the trinkets and to see if he can place what use they may have had*

*Quinn grits her teeth as she walks, small beads of sweat beginning to form at her brow. Her leg did not appreciate being walked on still, and when Ra'vek points out the abandoned caravan, she approaches it, taking a second to lean against one of the trees.* "Why would someone leave these behind?" *She asks, rubbing her leg as she looks over the neglected campsite.*
Aillig MacCaird makes a History check! 1d20 (4) + 7 = `11`
Aillig MacCaird makes an Arcana check! 1d20 (3) + 7 = `10`
Quinn makes a Perception check! 1d20 (**20**) + 7 = `27`

> *Aillig tries to remember anything about caravans or trinkets from his historical and arcana studies that may apply here, but this is a foreign swamp to him and he mostly draws a blank. Someone clearly place them with purpose, but perhaps it was just for whimsy and charm.*

> *Quinn focuses her attention on the scene while avoiding the nagging throb of her leg.*
> 
> *She notices the moss-covered structure is half-sunk into the soggy ground, leaning precariously against the gnarled roots of a massive willow tree. Despite its state of disrepair, the caravan exudes an undeniable charm.  It's then that she notices a faint, pleasant aroma of herbs and flowers lingers in the air, mingling oddly with the swamp‚Äôs earthy scent.  It's too fresh.*
> 
> *This isn't a neglected campsite, but someone's attempt into making this a home.*

"Huh." *Quinn tilts her head, peering further at the caravan before noticing the smell in the air she didn't notice before. It was too new, especially when being surrounded by thick marshland.* "Someone's been here recently... The flowers and herbs are fresh." *She points to the basket where they were contained.* "Either someone just found this caravan and is trying to rennovate it, or they've been here a while, and this is their wagon."

> *As you examine the peculiar trinkets and dilapidated caravan, a rustle breaks the swamp‚Äôs eerie quiet.  A soft giggle echoes, followed by a sharp, playful voice.*
> ‚ÄúHo there, strangers, snooping round my den! I hope you‚Äôve not disturbed my treasures, for their spirits might not mend!‚Äù
>

*Mina finally starts to thrash and flail and sends rubble flying as she rights herself. Once out she calls to the others that flame or godly light would be required to finish the job and she had neither so she‚Äôd focus the ooze.*

Aillig MacCaird casts True Strike!

*Aillig raises up his cane and concentrates on the sigils carved into the metal cap at the tip, which suddenly flare into a bright white light, almost to much to look at. Driving forward with a surety born from his extensive research into unnatural beings he spears the radiant end of the cane right into one of the creature's eyes, whereupon the light, rather than disappearing, seems to grow even brighter and begins to stream out of the eyes, nose, mouth and ears of the undead. After a moment the light fades and goes out and the creature drops to the ground in a lifeless (and unlifeless) heap.*

Quinn attacks with a Snake Eyes!  BP1: <Bloodied> (-12)

*Quinn had no fire or light, but she did have her arrows. Hearing the scream from below, she quickly fires two arrows at the sludge before seeing light burst from the hole, filling the rooms with bright light, and has to adjust her stance to not be blinded by it.*
> *With Aillig‚Äôs true strike the undead creature‚Äôs skin fails to regenerate and instead starts to shrink and decay into brown and black and then dust.  All that remains is a skeleton.*
> *The black pudding has had enough of Quinn‚Äôs arrows and attempts to flee back down the wall.*

Quinn attacks with a Dagger!  BP1: <Dead> (-9) 

Note:**To Hit**: 1d20 (**20**) + 7 = `27`

piercing = `9`,
